basic_node.title: Absorption by object parts
basic_node.description: Object parts absorbing portions of beam. Hence, converting incoming light engery into kinetic and thermal energy.
basic_node.references: [re1, https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/8500511/, Mutual influence of absorption; reflection and transmission: A + R + T = 1 with hemispherical absorptance A; hemispherical reflectance R; hemispherical transmittance T. Thus; bigger portion of transmission and absorbtion of beam implies lower portion of beam being reflected.] [re1, https://linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/S0924271612000378, Mutual influence of absorption; reflection and transmission: A + R + T = 1 with hemispherical absorptance A; hemispherical reflectance R; hemispherical transmittance T. Thus; bigger portion of transmission and absorbtion of beam implies lower portion of beam being reflected.] [re1, http://link.springer.com/10.1007/978-3-319-12352-3_18, Mutual influence of absorption; reflection and transmission: A + R + T = 1 with hemispherical absorptance A; hemispherical reflectance R; hemispherical transmittance T. Thus; bigger portion of transmission and absorbtion of beam implies lower portion of beam being reflected. See p.415.]
